page.title: 01South & east of Inveruplan
page.content: The area in question is primarily uncultivated non-woodland vegetation with one small farm (croft) presently in use. The area is mainly used for recreational purposes, ie, salmon fishing, deer stalking and hill walking although the land is common grazing for sheep from crofters of nearby townships. There is also a bothy, which is a shelter for hill walkers to spend the night in. One of the paths in the area is an old right of way dating back hundreds of years though now little used.
